citation.article-title: Treponema socranskii sp. nov., Treponema socranskii subsp. socranskii subsp. nov. Treponema socranskii subsp. buccale subsp. nov., and Treponema socranskii subsp. paredis subsp. nov. isolated from human periodontia

p.s: Treponema socranskii subsp. buccale subsp. nov.
Treponema socranskii subsp. buccale (buc.ca'le. L. N. bucca cheek: N.L. neu. adj. buccale pertaining to a cheek)
Treponemes in homology group A2 are designated Treponema socranskii subsp. buccale.
Phenotypic characteristics of this subspecies are shown in Table 3.
Other characteristics of the subspecies are the same as those of the species.
The type strain of T. socranskii subsp. buccale is strain ATCC 35534 (= VPI D2B8), which was isolated from a subgingival sample from a patient with moderate periodontal disease.
The patterns of phenotypic reactions in Table 3 show that T. socranskii subsp. socranskii (homology group Al) cannot be readily differentiated from T. socranskii subsp. buccale (homology group A2).

However, when we used a slide agglutination test with washed cells as the antigen, 11 of 12 T. socranskii subsp. socranskii strains agglutinated antisera against the type strain (strain ATCC 35536) and strain VPI D43BR1.
These antisera did not agglutinate any strain of either T. socranskii subsp. buccale or T . socranskii subsp. paredis.
Of 10 T. socranskii subsp. buccale strains, 7 agglutinated antisera against the type strain (strain ATCC 35534) and strains VPI D11A1 and VPI D40DPE1 of T. socranskii subsp. buccale.
These antisera did not agglutinate any strain of either T. socranskii subsp. socranskii or T. socranskii subsp. buccale.

Antiserum against the type strain of T . socranskii subsp. paredis (strain ATCC 35535) was agglutinated by seven of nine T . socranskii subsp. paredis strains but not by any strain of either T. socranskii subsp. socranskii or T. socranskii subsp. buccale.
